page.title: 13Abbotsley Feast week
page.content: (continued from page 12) Also in the churchyard there is a tomb which is named Haylock's tomb. When Haylock died he left money for the villagers to buy bread once a year. This charity is now shared out by the Parish Council at Christmas and the old age pensioners receive about Â£6.00 each. Feast week Abbotsley feast is held around St Margaret's day,July 20th.Every year we hold a fete on the Green.At the fete we have stalls such as :Tombola, White elephant,Cake,Guess the name of the animal,Smash the china,Hit the rat,Bowling,Throw a wet sponge,Roll_a_ penny,Greasy pole and Treasure hunt. Teas are provided by the W.I.There are competitions for adults and children like painting,cakes,flower arrangement sport and fancy dress.
